intro: Assaracus capax var. plenus, commonly known as the full-flowered assaracus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its flowers are pale yellow to white, appearing in dense, spherical clusters that give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable choice for garden cultivation.
